thread.title: Jet2 cabin luggage restrictions

author: Lizzie Porter
title: Jet2 cabin luggage restrictions
text: How many pieces of luggage can I bring in the cabin with me? One. Size: 56 x 45 x 25cm, including wheels and handles. Weight: 10kg Can I book a hold bag on a single leg, and travel hand-luggage only on the other? Jet2 does not give passengers the option of booking a bag for one leg only when they reserve a return flight. It will default to "bag both ways" as you go through the booking process. Related Articles Monarch cabin luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Thomson hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Thomas Cook hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Virgin Atlantic hand luggage restrictions 03 Aug 2015 Am I allowed any items in addition to my one cabin bag ? Extra handbags are not allowed. Anything else? On busy flights, cabin bags may have to be placed in the hold at the gate. There is no charge for this - but you will have to wait at the carousel to retrieve your bag at the other end. Collapsible pushchairs/buggies must be carried as checked luggage in the hold, and must not weigh more than 10kg. See Jet2's baggage guidelines page . Suggested suitcase: BHS World's Lightest suitcase range Price: Â£35.99 Size: 55.4cm x 35.5cm x 24.5cm Details: bhs.co.uk
